properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 7 at 8:45PM EST until February 8 at 4:27PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers
in North Carolina...South Carolina...


French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Henderson and Transylvania
Counties.
French Broad River Near Fletcher affecting Buncombe and Henderson
Counties.
South Fork Catawba River At Lowell affecting Gaston County.
Saluda River At West Pelzer affecting Anderson and Greenville
Counties.
Saluda River Near Greenville affecting Greenville and Pickens
Counties.
S Yadkin River At below Foster Rd. 6 SW Mocksville affecting Davie
and Rowan Counties.
Broad River In SC Near Blacksburg affecting Cherokee and York
Counties.

.Runoff from previous heavy rain will result in the rivers remaining
above flood stage.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Broad River In SC Near Blacksburg.
* until Saturday afternoon.
* At  8:15 PM Friday the stage was 20.5 feet.
* Minor Flood Stage is 16.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* FORECAST: The river will continue to fall to below Minor Flood
Stage by early Saturday morning.
* Impact...At 20.0 feet...Minor Flooding continues.  The Cherokee
Falls Hydro Project operations may be impacted by excessively high
flows.  Floodwaters may be impacting access to the Cherokee Falls
powerhouse and inundating residential yards adjacent to the river.
* Impact...At 19.5 feet...Minor Flooding continues.  Several
secondary roads near the river may be inundated.
* Impact...At 18.0 feet...Minor Flooding continues.  The Broad River
may be approaching Wolf Den Rd.  Floodwaters may be inundating
Little Hope Rd. and River Rd.  Floodwaters at this level will be
similar to levels that occurred on October 8th, 2005.
* Impact...At 16.0 feet...Minor Flood Stage.  The Broad River may be
flooding River Rd. and Little Hope Rd. near US 29.  Farmland
flooding is continuing adjacent to the river.  Floodwaters at this
level will be similar to levels that occurred on July 8th, 2005.
properties.instruction:
The latest stages and forecasts for rivers can be found on our web
page at http://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp

Please report high water...flooding and landslides to the National
Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free...1...8 0
0...2 6 7...8 1 0 1...or by posting on our Facebook page...or tweet
it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and
the specific location where it occurred.
